title: zeroday attacksTimetoDivert
extract: Zero day actually refers to two things—a zero-day vulnerability or a zero-day exploit. Zero-day vulnerability refers to a security hole in software—such as browser software or operating system software—that is yet unknown to the software maker or to antivirus vendors.Nov 11, 2014
extract_html: Zero day actually refers to two things—a zero-day vulnerability or a zero-day exploit. Zero-day vulnerability refers to a security hole in software—such as browser software or operating system software—that is yet unknown to the software maker or to antivirus vendors.Nov 11, 2014
